INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Com o avanзo da internet, o contato entre pessoas de diferentes paнses se tornou mais prуximo. As bibliotecas, em busca de acompanhar o desenvolvimento tecnolуgico e serem ativas na comunicaзгo, estгo usando ferramentas que permitem аs instituiзхes maior interatividade e comunicaзгo na relaзгo com os usuбrios reais e potenciais, atingindo pъblicos inimaginбveis. O objetivo deste trabalho й analisar o uso de blog e facebook como ferramentas de comunicaзгo da biblioteca da Unifesp Campus Osasco - EPPEN e como eles podem colaborar para compartilhamento e criaзгo de conhecimentos e de Intelectuais coletivos, como espaзos de interaзгo e trocas e sendo agentes na construзгo do conhecimento. Para tal, usaremos a abordagem conceitual de Pierre Lйvy.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Metodologia de identificaзгo de fluxos de informaзгo: o caso da coopernatuz de osasco
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Methodology for the Identification of the Flows of Information: The case of Coopernatuz of Osasco

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Outras atividades profissionais, cientнficas e tйcnicas

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract. The article presents results of the application of a Methodology for the Identifi cation of the Flows of Information in a solid waste cooperative located in the city of Osasco (state of Sгo Paulo, Brazil) that sorts and sells recyclable materials. Coopernatuz is part of a Public Policy Program called ?Osasco Solidбria?, which is a pioneer experiment consisting of a public incubator that assists cooperatives by providing technical and administrative consultancy as well as theoretical training on topics concerning the Solidarity Economy. The article discusses the mapping of the Cooperative?s activities and explains the context of the information fl ows. The application of that methodology focused on understanding the fl ows of information, which value the knowledge acquired by people through practice, techniques and skills. This was done through a case study and fi eld research that consisted of observing the Cooperative?s work and of interviews with members of it. The application of the Methodology for the Identifi cation of Information Flows showed how the members relate inside and outside the Cooperative, including the activities of its leaders and four working teams. The mapping of the information fl ows makes it possible to see problems in the Cooperative?s administration and in the division of its production, serving as material for possible changes in its activities. Since the Cooperative is a successful experiment in many respects, this work can contribute important elements for further analysis.
